info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHERN DEARBORN, NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND, NORTHERN KENTON, BOONE, CENTRAL GALLATIN AND SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located from near Shawnee to near Dillsboro, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Elsmere, Villa Hills, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Crescent Springs, Aurora, Crestview Hills, Rising Sun, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Dillsboro, Shawnee, Delshire, Delhi Hills and Wilmington. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 179 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
